questions.question: Question 1: Which of the following is false about mental health?

options.a: Mental disorders are universal, not specific to any group
options.b: Mental health is the mere absence of mental illness
options.c: Heredity can contribute to mental illnesses
options.d: Substance abuse is a type of mental illness

questions.explanation:
Mental health is a state of well-being in which an individual realizes his or her own abilities and 
not merely the absence of mental illness. It is the ability to cope with stress, be productive, and 
contribute to the community. Mental disorders are universal and are not specific to any particular group. They are associated 
with hereditary (family history of psychiatric disorders) and environmental factors. Substance 
abuse and alcohol addiction are considered types of mental illness.

questions.question: Question 2: Which of the following are sociopathological factors associated with mental health?
questions.explanation:
Economic insecurity, anxiety, and frustration are the sociopathological factors associated with 
mental health. The factors leading to mental health illnesses include: • Organic - cerebral arteriosclerosis, neoplasms, endocrine, metabolic and chronic diseases • Hereditary - schizophrenia • Socio-pathological factors - worries, anxiety, frustration, emotional stress, tension, unhappy 
marriages, broken homes, poverty, industrialization, urbanization, changing family structure, 900 
Sold by @itachibot population mobility, economic insecurity, cruelty, rejection, neglect. • Environmental - environmental toxins, substance abuse, radiation, nutritional factors, mineral 
deficiencies, infectious diseases during prenatal, perinatal, and postnatal periods (like rubella), 
road traffic accidents.

questions.question:
Question 3: The incidence of mental illness is higher in individuals who are exposed to causal factors 
during which period of life?
questions.explanation:
Exposure to causal factors during the initial 5 years of life leads to an increased incidence of 
mental illness. This period is critical for lifelong mental health behavior and learning, even more crucial 
than adolescence. During early childhood, the growth and development of children are most 
vulnerable to external environmental stressors. A continuous, intimate, and warm relationship 
with the child's parents during infancy and childhood is very important.

questions.question:
Question 4: All of the following can be used for the secondary prevention of mental illness in patients 
except:
questions.explanation:
Improving the social environment is a method of primary prevention of mental illness, not 
secondary prevention. The levels of prevention of mental illness and measures are given below: • Primary prevention - improving the social environment and the promotion of mental health 
awareness • Secondary prevention - early diagnosis and family-based health services like casework and family 
counseling • Tertiary prevention - measures to reduce the duration of mental illness as well family and 
community stresses to prevent further breakdown and disruption

questions.question:
Question 5: Patients with which of the following conditions are considered to have a major mental 
illness?
questions.explanation:
Patients with manic depressive psychosis are considered to have a major mental illness. Mental health disorders are classified as: • Major (psychotic or not in touch with reality) - include schizophrenia, manic depressive 
psychosis, and paranoia • Minor (non-psychotic, remain in touch with reality) - include neuroses (like OCD), personality 
and character disorders Dementia occurs secondary to organic causes. 901

questions.question: Question 6: Which of the following is not a service offered to patients with mental health disorders?
questions.explanation:
Employment services are not included under mental health services. Mental health services include: • Early diagnosis and treatment • Group and individual psychotherapy • Mental health education • Use of modern psychoactive drugs • Rehabilitation • After-care services - help drug-dependent persons to adapt to regular life following treatment 
and rehabilitation

questions.question:
Question 7: A 32-year-old man is brought to the casualty with a suspected drug overdose. His sister tells 
you that he has recently started taking a 'superman drug' after hearing about it from his 
friends. What drug is she referring to?
questions.explanation:
Amphetamines are also known as the superman drug. This is because their effects include increased self-confidence and endurance. However, its usage 
leads to tolerance and dependence.

questions.question: Question 8: What is currently the most widely used illicit substance in the world?
questions.explanation:
Cannabis is the most widely used illicit substance in the world. Cannabis is obtained from Cannabis sativa, C. indica, and C. americana. It is colloquially called 
marijuana. Other forms of this drug are charas or hashish and bhang. The image given below shows the cannabis plant. 902

questions.question: Question 9: What is the most widely used legal addictive substance in India?
questions.explanation:
Tobacco is the most widely used legal addictive substance in India, followed closely by alcohol as 
the second most widely consumed substance.

questions.question: Question 10: Which of the following is not an objective of the National Mental Health Programme of 1982?

options.a: Ensure equal human rights to mentally ill
options.b: Promote community participation in mental health services
options.c: Promote application of mental health knowledge
options.d: Provide accessibility of mental health care

questions.explanation:
Ensuring equal rights to mentally ill people is not an objective of the National Mental Health 
Programme (NMHP). It was launched in 1982 with the following objectives: • Ensure availability and accessibility of minimum mental health care • Encourage the application of mental health knowledge in general care • Promote community participation in mental health services development The National Mental Health Programme was relaunched as The Mental Health Care Act, 2017 
which includes provisions for equal rights for those with mental illness.

questions.question: Question 11: Which of the following is not a component of the District Mental Health Programme?
questions.explanation:
Screening is not a component of the District Mental Health Programme. It includes the following 
components: • Training of all mental health workers at the nodal institute in the state • Increasing public awareness by education to reduce stigma • Early detection and treatment • Providing data for future planning, improvement in service and research Activities by the DMHP for positive mental health include: • School mental health services • College counseling services • Workplace stress management • Suicide prevention services

questions.question: Question 12: Which of the following is not included in the Mental Healthcare Act of 2017?

options.a: Advance directive rights of the mentally ill
options.d: Procedure for admission, treatment and discharge of the mentally ill

questions.explanation:
Establishing mobile mental health camps for the benefit of mentally ill patients is not included 
under the Mental Healthcare Act of 2017. 903 
Sold by @itachibot This act encourages the mobilization of resources to improve mental health care across the 
country as well as reduce stigma and improve social inclusion/support for those with mental 
illness. It also has provisions to improve outcomes and protect their rights. The provisions of this act include: • Rights of persons with mental illness to access health care, live without discrimination and enjoy 
confidentiality. • Advance directives to allow mentally ill people to make decisions about their treatment • Procedures for admission, treatment (behavioral and interpersonal therapy, medications), and 
discharge • Decriminalizing suicide and prohibiting electroconvulsive therapy unless anesthesia is used The act also has clear instructions for the central and state mental health authorities and other 
mental health establishments on their endeavors.

questions.question:
Question 13: According to the WHO Mental Health Gap Action Programme, which of the following is not 
included in the Mental Health Care Act, 2017?
questions.explanation:
According to the WHO Mental Health Gap Action Programme (mhGAP), screening of family 
members is not included in the Mental Health Care Act, 2017. The Mental Healthcare Act of 2017 has provisions that include: • Rights of persons with mental illness to access health care, live without discrimination and enjoy 
confidentiality. • Advance directives to allow mentally ill people to make decisions about their treatment • Procedures for admission, treatment (behavioral and interpersonal therapy, medications), and 
discharge • Decriminalizing suicide and prohibiting electroconvulsive therapy unless anesthesia is used These are achieved through the mobilization of resources to required areas, and by providing 
social support.

Question 14: The National Suicide Prevention Strategy aims to reduce suicide mortality by

questions.explanation:
The National Suicide Prevention Strategy (NSPS) aims to reduce suicide mortality by 10% in India 
by 2030. It is a multisectoral approach that will involve national and international government 
ministries, families, communities, and educational institutes to help prevent suicide. India has a high burden of suicide. It is the leading cause of death among individuals between 
15-29 years of age. Epidemiology • Young and middle-aged adults between 18-45 years • Males more than females 904 
Sold by @itachibot • Daily wage earners and people who earn <1,00,000 per annum • Individuals with family issues and illnesses Hanging and poisoning were the most common methods of suicide. It accounts for >3/4th of all 
suicides. Risk factors for suicide • Psychiatric illnesses- Depression, BPD, schizophrenia, and anxiety disorders • Alcohol and other substance abuse disorders • Major physical illness • Job or financial loss • Relationship or social loss • Domestic violence or abuse • Lack of social support • The stigma associated with help-seeking behavior of mental disorders • Lack of social support and sense of isolation.

questions.question:
Question 15: Which of the following is not a component of the REDS path in the National suicide 
prevention strategy?

options.a: Both male and female offspring are affected

questions.explanation:
The National Suicide Prevention Strategy (NSPS) is a multisectoral approach that will involve 
national and international government ministries, families and communities, and educational 
institutes. It aims to reduce suicide mortality by 10% in India by 2030. It recommends REDS path for suicide prevention. • Reinforce leadership, partnership, and institutional capacity in the country • Enhance the health services capacity to provide suicide prevention services • Develop community resilience, societal support for suicide prevention and reduce stigma against 
suicidal behaviours • Strengthen surveillance and evidence generation. Objectives • To establish effective surveillance mechanism for suicide prevention in next 3 years • To establish psychiatric OPDs that provide suicide prevention services through District Mental 
Health Programme, within next 5 years • To integrate mental well-being curriculum in all educational institutes within next 8 years. 905
